arm_group.description: Geriatric trauma pateints being admitted to Saint Marys Hosptial.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to see if the investigators can identify early those patients
      who are admitted to the hospital and have a urinary tract infection (UTI) or those patients
      that develop a UTI during their hospitalization.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diagnosis of Subclinical Urinary Tract Infections Using Advanced Microbiome Survey Techniques in High Risk Trauma Patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  65 years old or older admitted as a result of trauma to Saint Marys Hospital at Mayo
             Clinic

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Prisoners

          -  Pregnancy

          -  Active urinary tract stones

          -  Less than 65 years of age

study_pop.textblock: Geriatric traumatic injury patients that were admitted to Saint Marys Hospital.

clinical_study.official_title: Diagnosis of Subclinical Urinary Tract Infections Using Advanced Microbiome Survey Techniques in High Risk Trauma Patients

primary_outcome.description: To identify which bacteria, genes and proteins will be highly predictive of UTI development in geriatric trauma patients.  We hypothesize that the combination of 16S rDNA and metaproteomics will identify the most informative biosignatures (species/genes/proteins) discerning UTI from asymptomatic bacteriuria.
primary_outcome.measure: Identify of bacteria, genes and proteins that are highly predictive of UTI development

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomarker candidates for UTIs recalcitrant to antibiotic treatment.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
